tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE pedestrian_cyclist_safety (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  safety_rating INT,
  incident_date DATE,
  incident_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE pedestrian_safety (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   location VARCHAR(255),
   incident_date DATE,
   incident_type VARCHAR(50),
   description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE cyclist_safety (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   location VARCHAR(255),
   incident_date DATE,
   incident_type VARCHAR(50),
   description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE PedestrianSafety (
  ID INT,
  Location VARCHAR(255),
  IncidentType VARCHAR(50),
  IncidentDateTime TIMESTAMP,
  PRIMARY KEY (ID)
)

CREATE TABLE CyclistSafety (
  ID INT,
  Location VARCHAR(255),
  IncidentType VARCHAR(50),
  IncidentDateTime TIMESTAMP,
  PRIMARY KEY (ID)
)

CREATE TABLE UrbanPlanning (
  ID INT,
  ProjectName VARCHAR(255),
  ProjectStatus VARCHAR(50),
  ProjectBudget DECIMAL(10,2),
  PRIMARY KEY (ID)
)

CREATE TABLE PedestrianAccidents (
    accident_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    accident_date DATE,
    injured_person VARCHAR(50),
    accident_type VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE CyclistAccidents (
    accident_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    accident_date DATE,
    injured_cyclist VARCHAR(50),
    accident_type VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE SafetyMeasures (
    measure_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    measure_type VARCHAR(100),
    description TEXT,
    implementation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE UrbanAreas (
    area_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(100),
    area_population INT,
    average_income DECIMAL(10, 2),
    urban_plan VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE AccidentReports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    report_date DATE,
    reporter_name VARCHAR(100),
    report_description TEXT,
    report_type VARCHAR(50)
)
